quote_last: . The blinds had been earlier drawn down, seeming to disconnect time as well as shutting out the surly half-light of late morning.
title: The Murder Room
author: P.D. James

quote_last: the sun has already punched its ticket. Sinking, it stains the cobbles and stucco of the platz in a violin-coloured throb of light that you would have to be a stone not to find poignant.
title: The Yiddish Policemen's Union
author: Michael Chabon
